headline: Creamed Cabbage
description: Creamed cabbage with crispy bacon, shredded cabbage, and tangy sour cream is a super easy side dish you'll want to serve for St. Patrick's Day.

video.description: See how to make a creamy, incredibly easy cabbage side dish.
video.name: Creamed Cabbage

name: Creamed Cabbage
recipeIngredient: 1 large head cabbage, cored and shredded

recipeInstructions.text: Cook bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate.

Add butter, flour, and salt to the skillet; whisk with drippings over medium heat until butter melts. Add cabbage and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 15 minutes. Crumble bacon into the skillet. Stir in sour cream and cook until heated through, 1 to 2 minutes.

review.reviewBody: My adjustments were so numerous as to make it a different recipe but I did build upon it (smile). Like most others, I used half a head of cabbage. First I sautéed a large onion and minced garlic. I used a cup of chopped ham, used a cup of cream and spiced with two tsps of tarragon, kosher salt and pepper both to taste and added a tsp of sweet paprika.

Awesome! Like other reviewers, I added onion and garlic. All I had was a pound of turkey bacon so I didn't have any grease. I added 1/2 C of butter & deglazed the pan then added the cabbage, onion & garlic. I added pepper and smoked paprika for great color. I added the full pound of diced turkey. Will definitely make again!

My husband really liked this and complimented several times while eating. I liked-okay. Settling on a 4 since he would love if I made again but the tang on the sour cream is just not the creamed cabbage I am accustomed - which is okay! I halved the recipe entirely EXCEPT the bacon and then added some chopped onions to the cabbage sauté. Glad I tried & thanks for sharing!
Like some others I used half a head of cabbage. Also used 6 pieces of bacon, and was generous with both the butter and sour cream. Really delicious, and really great on a keto lifestyle!
Much too rich for our taste, but I don’t like carbonara dishes either.

I tweaked the recipe by adding some freshly ground black pepper, a wee bit more bacon and butter. I made this for our main dinner, and not a side dish. We love cabbage just about any way it can be cooked. This was easy to make. Only wish we had had some good, hard rolls to eat with this dish. Yes, we love our carbs.
yummy
Fast simple and delicious.

Impressed, very good! I used half a cabbage. Already had cooked crispy bacon so I just warmed it in the pan. Used the same amount of other ingredients to insure that it was creamy. I'm glad I didn't have the extra bacon grease un the pan. Didn't need it for taste. I also added the crumbled bacon while it was cooking. Not much to it for being so tasty. This will be another healthy vegetable side on my list.
Very tasty recipe! I added a little Splenda (which I thought would enhance the flavor), and it did!
I halved the salt and the flavor was still excellent.
I liked it but seems a little “greasy” maybe next time use a little less butter and I will also try some with a little Parmesan cheese sprinkled on.
This turned out fantastic. We had it as a side with our corned beef and had leftovers for the week. Did not change anything.

I don't eat a lot of cooked cabbage and I prefer corn beef and cooked cabbage, however, the only adjustment I made to your recipe was I cooked 6 slices of bacon and it was too greasy tasting for me. It probably would have been better if I would have taken some of the drippings out or stuck with your 4 slices.
My family loved this dish. I followed the recipe exactly, and when I make it again I won't change a thing. For cabbage lovers, this is a great option.
I wanted a different cabbage recipe for St. Patty's Day so I made this to go with The Glazed Corn Beef and hash brown pancakes. Nice twist from the traditional meal!

I can't believe I ever made cabbage any other way! After trying this heavenly dish I now make it with corned beef dishes or even fish or beef dishes. No more watery, limp boiled cabbage for us at our house! The only thing I would say is that this needs to be made and served at the last minute as the cabbage will lose its crispness, and will wilt and lose its green color if this sits for too long.

Excellent!!
Used Red Cabbage instead.Will make again for sure.
We really liked this recipe. It’s delicious. Next time less salt
I should have left the salt out.
Excellent! Added red pepper flakes to wake it up!
excellent
This is a delicious side dish. Thank you!
Fawwwwk, this was so delicious!
I made it as written and was not that inpressed
Made as written. It is very rich. Next time I would slightly reduce the amount of butter and sour cream. NOT the bacon though. Can't have too much bacon.
I usually do not care for cabbage, but this recipe changed that! It is by far the best way to make cabbage. I do, however, prefer it without the sour cream.
Loved the creamy cabbage recipe. Full of flavor and a little tang from the sour cream.
I used creamed spinach instead of the regular turned out amazing. Another winner to make

Never had creamed cabbage. Was looking for a recipe as I did not want to throw away my fresh head of cabbage. Recipe was easy and delish. I added a few tablespoons on cream cheese to add more richness to the recipe as well as salt to taste. Very comforting, filling side dish.

This was wonderful, even if it's not St. Pat's day. Very easy as well. I would skip making the roux, as it does not add much to the finished product. Used homemade smoked pork belly from our good friend in place of the bacon.

Will definitely make this again. I used gluten free flour with no problem. For personal preference, I sauteed onion with the cabbage and pepper with the flour and salt, and I wouldn't change a thing. So easy, quick, and yummy!
I love it! I did add a little garlic and onion. But it is fantastic.
i have made this recipe time and time again its super easy and so delicious... all my family love it!!! great recipe
I made it, it's beautiful and delicious! I will definitely make it again. Sure wish I could upload a photo.
Followed the exact recipe. It was amazing!! I was a little hesitant to add sour cream to it, but it was so good. Thanks for the recipe!
None
Love this recipe. Especially after St. Patrick’s Day to use up leftover cabbage. I added onions and grated carrots and cheddar cheese. So good!
Love it. I only had maple bacon and it turned out yum! It's a keeper.
Delicious!
We liked that it mellowed the strong cabbage taste....but found it to be a little on the watery side...
My husband and I just made this and absolutely loved it! No changes necessary.
easy enough to make with processor. Jazzed it up with an onion, some sausage and rather than sour cream, chipotle ranch dressing. yum!
OMG! I want this everyday! It is so good. I did like some said and only used half a head of cabbage so I could have more sauce. Amazing! Will be making this a staple in my dinner rotation.
yummy! What a great way to make cabbage. If you are on a keto diet, this is a great recipe.

I made this last night and my husband and I both really liked it. I only gave 4 stars because I did not totally follow directions... I used 1/2 a head of cabbage and made all the sauce. I added the sour cream off heat after a short rest as suggested by another reviewer. I also used 6 pieces of bacon because I'm a rebel :)
Absolutely delicious. My husband is avoiding carbs so I left out the flour and used heavy cream instead. The sour cream really makes the dish.
Family absolutely loved it! I added fresh onion

The whole family enjoyed this easy and delicious recipe. My shortcut was to use pre-cooked bacon bits (from Costco) sautéed with some butter. Everything else was as written. Just be sure not to over-cook the cabbage.
Very delicious!
Doesn’t look pretty, but it’s delicious and very simple to make.

KETO VERSION: omit the flour. I used leftover bacon fat because I was out of bacon so I fried up some chopped salami, after I had halfway sautéed cabbage... at the end I stirred in about quarter cup or so of sour cream and it’s pretty darn good ALSO sprinkled on some garlic salt and pepper for flavour
Delicious; substituted plain yogurt for the sour cream and used Wegmans basting oil and hormel real bacon bits instead of frying bacon and using drippings. Added onion and garlic.

This was very easy and a hit for my potluck. Several persons recalled their parents making this to extend the meal. I did add cayenne to my dish to give it the zing I like but it stands alone well. Have made it twice now this week and next time I will try baking it uncovered after par-cooking to give it a crust and different texture.
Made this, added mushrooms, garlic and onion. And more Pink Himalayan salt at end. Very good
This is amazing! I did not add the flour (I don't think it adds anything), and added a bit of garlic - winning combo! This is my new favorite way to eat cabbage.
I loved this, followed the recipe exactly. I 'm on a diet and shouldn't have eaten it but sometimes you just need to break the rules!
Very good! Add some seasoning. Make it your own. Cabbage is my favorite vegetable and this made it even better

We wanted something different for our cabbage dish on new year's day. I chose this one because it sounded interesting, easy to make and I had all the ingredients. I am so happy I did! This dish was a huge hit on my dinner table. For the first time ever, I had no leftover cabbage! I made it exactly as the recipe reads. I cant think of anything I could do to improve it. This is a keeper. Try it!
Very, very good. Am making it for New Years Day for company.

Very nice. Think it could have used just a bit of something like pepper to give it just a little kick. Certainly using a whole head of cabbage made A LOT of the dish. I will cut in half next time. My first four slices of bacon didn't produce as much grease as I think I was expecting so I browned 4 more slices but only used 1/8c margarine to help compensate for more bacon grease.
This is really good. And leftovers just as good. Will be making this again!
Terrific and easy variation on cabbage. We enjoyed it chilled the next day even more than day of and warm. I might add some red pepper next time.
It turned out great! So creamy and yummy! I love All Recipes. I feel like a true cook for the first time in my life. Thanks everyone!
5 stars all the way! This was wonderful. I almost didn't make this because I only had 2 slices of bacon. I am so glad I went ahead and prepared this.
I made mine like jennilynn77 with the Panko ...but prior to removing from skillet I added about 1/3 c of distilled vinegar and several dashes of Franks hot sauce - off the chart!
Loved it! Didn't have bacon so I substituted for prosciutto and a bit of oil. So yummy! Looking forward to trying with bacon as written.
I didn't have sour cream so I used Feta instead. Excellent!
Did not have bacon, used 1 lb smoke sausage and added extra sauteed onions. It was great.Will try it again with bacon.
Ok, even my 13 yr old boy couldn't get enough of this! Super good. Here is a tip: use the precooked bagged bacon if you are short on time. Tastes great.
I exactly followed the instructions and it was awesome! Everyone love it! At fist so thought that it was going to be a lot of cabbage but when it is cooked it goes small. It is a great side dish.

the absolute best I've ever made...i loved adding flour to make it slightly creamy...we will make this way from now on...i followed to as written only i was out of bacon..i used stored bacon fat and added ham chunks to the bacon oil also assed onion's then the flour...browned nicely, added chicken broth then cabbage...
Delicious, so simple but SO tasty ! For Christmas i an going to add Chestnuts :)
Very Good. Adding to rotation. I also use the leftovers and put them in grilled cheese sandwich. Both kids liked them better that way. I liked them both ways.
Really. Good. I forgot to add the butter and it was creamy and delicious.
This recipe was great! Some of the best cabbage I've made. Even my 10 year old grandson loved it.
Wow this ROCKS! Don't change a thing with this recipe!
I added a bit of heavy cream and will increase the amount of bacon next time
This is a favorite of my family and friends on New Year's Day--I have made it several times. Sometimes I sauté an onion in for a variation. Always a hit!

Made it and enjoyed it! I was out of sour cream so I used the same amount of cream cheese instead of the sour cream. I also put a quarter cup of plain Greek yogurt. I didn't use flour because the cream cheese made it thick enough as it was. Turned out great!
Loved this. Made as written, didn't change a thing. This one goes into the regular rotation.
This was so delicious & quick to make!
Made this vegetarian without the bacon. Added some carmelized onion per another reviewer, and this was just amazing!
For 11 years I've searched for a recipe for creamed cabbage that my husband would enjoy. 11 YEARS. This one hit it out of the park! THANKS.
I used bacon drippings instead of butter. I added small bits of potato too. So simple & good

Excellent flavor with minimum work. My skillet wasn't deep enough so I didn't use all of the cabbage I'd planned. This recipe was a bit rich for my blood. When I make it next, I will experiment with less butter, less salt and just a bit of the bacon drippings for flavor. Thanks!
So nice surprise, very Good!
Yes I made this creamed cabbage was concerned about using sour cream but it was very creamy & delish
I made no changes to this recipe. Thought it was very good.

This is excellent as written. I've made it a couple more times adding what ever is on hand. If you have diced ham instead of bacon, don't worry, it's still great (just add some type of oil, maybe 1tbsp ). I've also shredded carrots into the mix, minced garlic, beef or chicken stock (or cubes). Good with coconut oil instead of bacon fat, try also with Sriracha, cayenne, and a dash of Tabasco for some kick. Mushrooms are good in it, diced potatoes, parsnips, turnip (may need to be steamed a few minutes). Again, don't go crazy and add all these extra ingredients, but it's a solid and versatile recipe that I'll continue to experiment with lol!
Edit: I've never added flour to it either, turns out fine.
Sooooo good! Yummy to the max. Only thing I did different was to add onion powder. Will be making it again and again.
This was great! I used precooked bacon, so I added a few more pieces. I will definitely make again.
I made this recipe as written and it was great. The second time I made it I added onion and cooked it with bacon. It was even better.
This recipe was very good. Next time I will use only a 1/2 head of cabbage so that it all will get coated. The bacon added a delightful crunch. My husband was very pleased!

I used a package of bacon cooked this and half cup of Tasso. I then took an onion and cook the onion and the bacon fat. Didn't use all the bacon just the bacon fat. Then I followed the rest of the recipe and used a whole head of cabbage and a cup of light sour cream. Someone else had recommended putting breadcrumbs on top and I did this but I think it's better to mix it with a little butter and toast it and then put it on top rather than put it in the oven because my bread crumbs never toasted. I ended up just mixing it in and it tasted great but if you wanted that breadcrumb topping look then make sure you mix it with some better something. It's not a healthy recipe at all but it taste great
Certainly didn't look like the picture, and after modifying with more bacon, and more sour cream, I stiff wasn't impressed. I liked another cabbage recipe with ground beef and tomato sauce.
I love cabbage, and this is a delicious way to prepare it. I could eat this every day! Thanks for sharing!

Never used sour cream in a hot cabbage dish, was a nice difference. No bacon but found about a third of a good hard salami stick, I made salami crisps in place of the bacon. Also added a few tablespoons of chopped red onion, a dash of garlic salt, and about 2 cups of roasted baby yellow potatoes....hard to get the rest of the family to eat cabbage.

OMG!!! This was soooooo good and very easy to make. I had never heard of creamed cabbage before and was a little leery after reading the ingredients, but I had a small head of cabbage in the fridge and needed a different and quick recipe. This was a gold mine find!!! My husband couldn't get enough of this. I didn't change a thing in the recipe, but may add a slice or two more bacon next time just because I LOVE BACON!!!! Thanks for this recipe.
